newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania OTC market ends in mixed picture.
newsitem.headline: Romania OTC market ends in mixed picture.

text.p: Romania's over-the-counter (OTC) share market ended mixed on Monday as big investors awaited fresh lows in the prices of major companies ahead of an expected rise later in the week.

The independent index VAB-RASDAQ, computed by VANGUARD securities, rose by 0.49 percent from the previous session to 3,568.47 points. Another unofficial index, the BIG-OTC, compiled by BIG brokerage house, slipped 0.3 percent to 2,609.53 points.
Operators said the slide might continue in some of the listings for a day or two. They expected a rally later in the week.
"The downswing in some of the attractive stocks has been taking hold for quite some time," a trader said. "The market is due to see a rebound."
Cement makers stayed in the limelight, with Romcim closing 500 lei stronger at 65,500 and Casial inching down by 150 lei to end at 1,500 in greater supply.
Oil refinery Arpechim, another key attraction, ended flat at 25,000 lei.

Plane maker IAR gained 1,000 lei to close at 41,000 in thin trade and operators said they expected the stock to make further gains thanks to a deal with U.S. helicopter maker Bell Helicopter Textron to be signed this week.
Under the deal, Bell Helicopter would buy a significant stake of the Romanian company. Details of the deal are expected on Wednesday.
Overall turnover climbed to 8.08 billion lei from 7.32 billion last Friday with more than 3.5 million shares changing hands.
